intro: Coussarea triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered coussarea, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Coussarea triflora is often found in moist, shaded forest environments, where it thrives in the understory.
